الفتوحات المكية
Al-Futūḥāt al- Makkiya fī maʿrifat al-asrār al-mālikiyya wa-l-mulkiyya
Revelations of Mecca
bibl.incipit: al-ḥamdu lilāh alladhī awjad al-ashiyāʾ ʿan ʿadam wa-ʿadamahu wa-awqaf wajūdahā ʿalā tuwajjah kalimihi li-nataḥaqqaq bidhālik sir ḥudūthhā wa-qidamahā min qidamahi
bibl.author: Ibn al-ʿArabī

noteGrp.note: Ibn ʿArabī’s great summary of esoteric knowledge, consisting of 560 chapters and extending to nearly 10,000 pages in the holograph. It totalises all aspects of his work and all the esoteric knowledge of his era. The first recension, completed in Ṣafar 629H, exists only in copies, while the second, written between 632H and 636H, survives in IA’s own hand (see Evkaf Muzesi 1845+). There is still work to be done in distinguishing between the two recensions in the mss base, but considerable progress has been made by Julian Cook and Claude Addas in identifying “markers” which indicate the recension of any given ms. Their research indicates that many later mss. may be hybrids of the two recensions. For details of their work on the two recensions, see ancillary documents.

bibl.note: Verified by many mss. in both recensions. The best of the second recension is Evkaf Muzesi 1845+ in 37 volumes, which is the original in IA’s hand, written in 636H and carrying over 71 samāʿ.

noteGrp.note: Two critical editions exist. The first, edited by Osman Yahia (Cairo, 1970+) consists of 14 volumes and is incomplete. The second , edited by ʿAbd al-ʿAzīz Sulṭān al-Manṣūb (Yemen, 2011) is in 12 volumes and is complete. It is largely based upon the Konya autograph – the manuscript of the second recension of the book written in 37 sections by Ibn ʿArabī himself – but also takes into account other texts. Critical edition of the poems on the letters in chapter 2 by Maurizio Marconi in Azufre Rojo vo. 7 (2020).

There is as yet no complete translation of the Futūḥāt. Eric Winkel is working on one, and information on how to access his translation can be found on http://www.ibnarabisociety.org/infopdf/futuhat-winkel-announcement.pdf. and https://www.createspace.com/pub/simplesitesearch.search.do?sitesearch_query=Eric+A.+Winkel&sitesearch_type=STORE.
